forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 48. West wind around 12 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Partly sunny. High near 54, with temperatures falling to around 51 in the afternoon. West northwest wind 13 to 20 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph. Chance of precipitation is 50%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In the quiet hours of the early morning, Downtown San Francisco is enveloped in a gentle haze, hinting at the rain that may soon kiss the pavement beneath the weight of the looming clouds. The temperature is brisk, suggesting a coat will be a wise choice as the wind whispers through the streets, carrying with it the promise of occasional showers. As the day unfurls, it may grant some moments of brightness, yet the specter of rain remains a constant companion, with temperatures gently slipping into the cool embrace of the afternoon.

The atmosphere is tinged with a certain melancholy beauty typical of early March, urging its inhabitants to don layers that provide warmth while allowing for the comfort of movement. As the city begins to stir, it's the perfect time to venture into your favorite café for a warm drink and a moment of reflection or to amble through lesser-traveled streets adorned with the aromas of fresh pastries and invigorating coffee. Daylight may struggle to pierce the clouds, but the San Francisco spirit thrives on unpredictability, offering opportunities for exploration around every corner, even as the fog and rain dance overhead.
